dict.acceptation: 一代人；代（约30年），时代；生殖；产生；

sent.orig: His name will be remembered generation after generation.
The recipe for making the liqueur has been handed down from generation to generation.
sent.trans: 这种酿酒方法世代相传。

sent.orig: Hayley McCrea: If younger generation will have an easier time multitasking than generation?
sent.trans: 海莉·麦克雷：年轻人是不是比老一代更擅长一心多用呢？

sent.orig: If only we treat the other generation as our equals, the generation gap will be bridged.
sent.trans: 只要是我们把不同辈的人当成与我们同辈的人看待，代沟就会消失。

sent.orig: This is the eager expectation that many older-generation calligraphers have placed on us younger-generation.
sent.trans: 这是许多老一辈书家们对我们后生的殷切期望。
